original: Materialize CSS is a CSS framework which contains library files. It is created with CSS, JavaScript and HTML. It is used to create attractive, reliable, and functional webpages and web apps.
result: Materialize CSS is a tool that designers use in building webpages and web apps. It's a library file that's made from CSS, HTML and JavaScript. It comes packed with features that enable designers to create visually appealing, dependable, and fully functional webpages and web apps.

original: Materialized CSS was released on 8 November 2015.
result: On November 8th, 2015, Materialized CSS was launched.

original: Following is a list of some salient features of Materialize CSS:
result: The following are some notable attributes of Materialize CSS:

original: It contains In-built responsive designing.
result: The software has a built-in feature for designing that is responsive.

original: It provides standard CSS with minimal footprint.
result: This platform offers a lightweight implementation of CSS that takes up very little space. It provides standard CSS functionality while minimizing its impact on the overall program.

original: It provides new versions of common user interface controls such as buttons, checkboxes, and text fields adapted to follow Material Design concepts.
result: The framework offers updated versions of familiar user interface components, such as text fields, buttons, and checkboxes, that are tailored to comply with the principles of Material Design.

original: It facilitates enhanced and specialized features such as cards, tabs, navigation bars, toasts, and so on.
result: Material Design is a popular design language that enables developers to create sleek and modern user interfaces. This design language offers an array of advanced features such as tabs, cards, navigation bars, toasts, and other specialty functionalities.

original: It is free to use and requires jQuery JavaScript library to function properly.
result: The tool can be used for free but it needs jQuery JavaScript library to operate effectively.

original: It is cross-browser supported, and can be used to create reusable web components.
result: Polymer is a framework that is capable of cross-browser support and used to create web components that can be used repeatedly.

original: There are two methods to use Materialize CSS:
result: There are a couple of ways to apply Materialize CSS:

original: Local Installation:  It is achieved by downloading the materialize.min.css and materialize.min.js files on our local machine and include them in your HTML code.
result: To install Materialize locally, we can download and save the materialize.min.css and materialize.min.js files on our computer. These files can then be included in our HTML code for use.

original: CDN Based Version:  By including the materialize.min.css and materialize.min.js files into our HTML code directly from the Content Delivery Network (CDN).
result: One way to add Materialize styling to our website is by directly accessing and including the materialize.min.css and materialize.min.js files from a Content Delivery Network (CDN).

original: A list of different Utility classes in Materialize CSS:
result:
Sure, here's a rephrased version:

Materialize CSS offers a variety of Utility classes that can be used to quickly style elements without manually writing CSS. Examples of these Utility classes include positioning, typography, colors, and sizing. By using Utility classes, developers can save time and streamline their styling process while maintaining a consistent design language.

original: Color utility classes:  Examples: .red, .green, .grey etc.
result: There are various color utility classes available that can be utilized for web development purposes. These classes allow developers to apply specific colors to elements on their webpage without having to manually define CSS styles. An example of such classes includes .red, .green, .grey, and others.

original: Alignment utility classes:  Examples: .valign-wrapper, .left-align, .right-align, .center-align, .left, .right etc.
result: Classes for alignment purpose are available in utility classes, for instance, .valign-wrapper, .left-align, .right-align, .center-align, .left, and .right.

original: Hiding Content utility classes as per device size:  Examples: .hide, .hide-on-small-only, .hide-on-med-only etc.
result: We can use utility classes to hide certain content based on the device size. Examples of such classes include .hide, .hide-on-small-only, and .hide-on-med-only.

original: Formatting utility classes:  Examples: truncate, hoverable etc.
result:
Here is a suggestion for rephrasing: 

One possible type of utility class is a formatting class. These classes can provide helpful design and style options for various elements of a website. Some examples of formatting utility classes include truncate and hoverable.

original: List of classes used to create responsive images and videos in Materialize CSS:
result: Below is a list of the various classes included in Materialize CSS that can be used to achieve responsive images and videos on your website.

original: responsive-img:  This class is used to create an responsive image.
result: The "responsive-img" class is a useful tool for creating images that adjust to fit different screen sizes.

original: video-container:  This class is used to create responsive container. That has embedded videos.
result: The video-container class is designed to generate a flexible container that can accommodate embedded videos that are responsive.

original: responsive-video:  This class is used to create HTML5 videos responsive.
result: The "responsive-video" class can be utilized to make HTML5 videos responsive in design.

original: Different classes of table in Materialize CSS:
result: Here are the various types of tables available in Materialize CSS:

original: It is used to represents a basic table without any border.
result: This code is employed in displaying a simple table that lacks any visible border.

original: It is used to display a stripped table.
result: A stripped table can be displayed using this feature.

original: It is used to create border in table.
result: This attribute is employed to form a boundary or edge around a table.

original: It is used to highlight the table.
result: This statement emphasizes the purpose of selecting text within a table.

original: It is used to create all the text in center aligns.
result: This tag is utilized for center aligning all text.

original: It is used to create responsive table.
result: Responsive tables are created using this tool.

original: A badge is a component which is used to provide an onscreen notification. It can be a number or icon. It is used to emphasize the number of items.
result: A badge serves as an onscreen alert or notification. It commonly displays a number or an icon to highlight the quantity of items.

original: The following classes of Badges are used in Materialize CSS:
result: Materialize CSS employs various kinds of Badges to enhance the appearance of its web pages.

original: Materialize CSS provides two classes for BreadCrumb:
result: Materialize CSS offers users a set of two classes that can be used for implementing BreadCrumb.

original: Chip is a component of Materialize CSS which represents a small set of information like a tag does.
result: The Chip feature in Materialize CSS serves as a means of displaying brief information, similar to the function of a tag.

original: Collection is a group of items having the related information. Following is a list of collection classes in Materialize CSS:
result: The Materialize CSS library contains various collection classes that are used to group related information. These classes enable designers and developers to create collections of items with ease.

original: It is used to set the div or ul container as collection.
result: The purpose of setting a div or ul container as a collection is to utilize its capabilities as a container for grouping and organizing items.

original: It is used to set the a or li item as collection item.
result: The purpose of using the collection-item CSS class is to designate a particular item, either an a or li element, as a part of a collection.

original: It shows the a or li item as active collection item.
result: This pertains to indicating the active item in a collection, represented by an "a" or "li" element.

original: It is used to mark the collection to have header.
result: This statement signifies that the purpose of the command is to designate the inclusion of a header in the collection.

original: It is a set the a or li item as collection header.
result: The recommendation is to designate a specific item, either a "a" or "li" element, as the header for a collection.

original: It is a set the a or li item as avatar item.
result: The avatar item can be set as either a list item (li) or an anchor tag (a).

original: it enables collection items to be swiped away. It works on touch screen devices only.
result: The swipe-to-dismiss feature allows users to easily get rid of collection items by simply swiping their touch screen devices.

original: You can create a pagination in Materialize CSS by using pagination class. This class is used with ul element.
result: To implement pagination in Materialize CSS, you need to utilize the pagination class, which should be applied to a ul element.

result: We can identify two categories of dropdown classes in Materialize CSS:
